verses.roman:
man-māhātmyaṁ mat-saparyāṁ
mac-chraddhāṁ man-mano-gatam
jānanti gopikāḥ pārtha
nānye jānanti tattvataḥ

synonyms: mat-māhātmyam—My greatness; mat-saparyām—My service; mat-śraddhām—respect for Me; mat-manaḥ-gatam—the intention of My mind; jānanti—they know; gopikāḥ—the gopīs; pārtha—O Arjuna; na—not; anye—others; jānanti—know; tattvataḥ—factually.
translation: "O Pārtha, the gopīs know My greatness, My loving service, respect for Me, and My mentality. Others cannot really know these."

purport.content: This verse was spoken by Lord Kṛṣṇa to Arjuna in the Ādi Purāṇa.
